Geohackweek

Workshop on geospatial data science

University of Washington eScience Institute

November 14-18, 2016

About Geohackweek

Geohackweek is a 5-day workshop to be held at the University of Washington eScience Institute. Participants will learn about open source technologies used to analyze geospatial datasets.

Mornings will consist of interactive lectures, and afternoon sessions will involve facilitated exploration of datasets and hands-on software development.

This format is inspired by astrohackweek and neurohackweek, similar programs focused on astrophysics and neuorphysics.

Information for applicants

To best benefit from the program, participants are expected to have some experience with programming (e.g. Python or similar) and with analysis of geospatial data (e.g. remote sensing analysis, vector mapping, environmental modeling, etc.).

Accepted applicants will be asked to pay a fee of $75 upon final registration. This fee will include participation in the course, and snacks and beverages during the day for the duration of the course.

Instructors

Randy LeVeque, UW Applied Math

Rob Fatland, UW IT Director of Cloud and Data Solutions

Anthony Arendt, UW eScience, APL

Catherine Kuhn, UW Ecosystem Biogeochemistry Group

Allison Smith, UW School of Oceanography

Ben Hudson, UW Polar Science Center, APL

Emilio Mayorga, UW Applied Physics Lab

Geohackweek 2016 Application

Deadline: September 15, 2016

Application Form

Successful applicants will be contacted after September 15, 2016 to pay $75 registration fee.

4:30 - 4:45 pm Break
4:45 pm - 5:30 pm set up for Tuesday GEE session Data Science Studio
evening Welcome reception Data Science Studio
